data.title: The sisterhood's rise
data.description: In a year marked by highly anticipated releases, Dune: Prophecy made a unique entry into HBO

data.title: The most wonderful time of the year
data.description: The last month of year has arrived with a festive atmosphere and shopping malls in Bangkok ready to showcase their best decorations for Christmas and New Year celebrations. For shoppers and revellers, here are some venues to stop by for some joyous moments and memorable photos.

data.title: Flood victims to get cash aid
data.description: Deputy Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said the government intends to compensate every household affected by flooding in the South with 9,000 baht in a similar fashion to payouts made to those recently affected by floods in the North.

data.title: Solar key to PAT 'green ports' push
data.description: The Port Authority of Thailand (PAT) has introduced solar rooftops at its ports in a bid to establish "green ports". The rooftops are expected to produce five million kilowatt-hours of solar energy annually.

data.title: Another title for Dechapol, Supissara
data.description: Mixed doubles players Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran claimed their second title after winning he US$210,000 BWF Syed Modi India International 2024 in Lucknow on Sunday.

data.title: Lamphun post convincing triumph at Nakhon Pathom
data.description: Lamphun Warriors fired on all cylinders on Saturday night when they routed hosts Nakhon Pathom United 3-0 in a Thai League 1 encounter.

data.title: Informal talks to seek Asean five-point consensus
data.description: Vientiane: The next extended informal consultation on the  Myanmar  crisis in Bangkok this month can help support the five-point consensus on Myanmar proposed by the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean), a senior Lao official said.

data.title: Bhumjaithai backs sea dispute debate
data.description: The Bhumjaithai Party is supporting Pheu Thai list MP Noppadon Pattama

data.title: Feeding energy-hungry AI tech advances
data.description: The growing popularity of  artificial intelligence  (AI) technology as a powerful new tool is raising questions of how the world can supply sufficient energy to resource-hungry  AI  while countries are shifting to clean energy.

data.title: Thaioil has backup plan to end CFP project delays
data.description: Thaioil Plc is prepared to exercise its rights under a parent guarantee agreement with the main contractors of the US$5.37 billion Clean Fuel Project (CFP) to resolve persistent project delays.

data.title: Phuket gears up for high season
data.description: Phuket will welcome visitors from around the world with the Phuket Carnival at Patong 2024, an annual event which marks the beginning of the high tourism season on the island.

data.title: Energy key to push for digital hub plan
data.description: The state

data.title: Govt seeks answer on ship attack
data.description: The government has lodged a formal protest with the Myanmar government, after a fleet of Thai fishing boats were attacked off the waters of Ranong on Saturday.

data.title: Chamber of Commerce urges Thai firms to step up exports to China
data.description: Thai exporters must be prepared for fiercer competition in Chinese markets

data.title: Greater Bangkok to face thick smog from Monday to Friday
data.description: The Pollution Control Department is warning that people in Greater Bangkok will face thick smog from Monday to Friday due to smoke from farmland and stagnant air over the capital and nearby provinces.

data.title: PRD to communicate with southern flood victims
data.description: Joint Information Centre to coordinate efforts to help flood victims in southern border provinces

data.title: Paetongtarn denies ignoring southern flood victims
data.description: PM says she assigned some Cabinet members to take immediate action to help victims

data.title: Explore December 2024 with Thailandâ€™s top events
data.description: TAT invites people to plan December travels with must-see events across the country

data.title: Chinese man arrested at Bangkok airport over luxury used car fraud
data.description: Police captured a Chinese citizen who allegedly committed crimes related to luxury used cars at Suvarnabhumi Airport on Sunday as he was about to board a flight to Cambodia.

data.title: Nation TV finds flood relief efforts wanting in South
data.description: Criticisms circulating on social media largely reflect truth, volunteers report
